oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The mud horse
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Egypt--Rural conditions; Egypt -- Social life and customs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B&W, 11 min. Arabic sound track, English subtitles. Made by the Egyptian fIlmmaker, Atiyat el-Abnoudi, ca. 1970. This fIlm shows various aspects of a brick factory in Kafr el-Shaikh governorate, stressing the role of human and animal labor. There are some brief interviews with workers, and (as an off-screen voice) with the manager of the factory. Can be used to illustrate a traditional industry, but also the division of labor and patterns of exploitation. like "Tuha's sad song", the fIlm concludes with a scene of people eating.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Ethnographic and Anthropological Films - Egypt and Beyond
